page.title: 05GOVAN PUBLIC V's POLICE
page.content: Although the police are seen to have a difficult job,they are unpopular with teenagers who feel harassed by the police moving them on from street corners where they gather often just to talk. The police are rough in manner, often coarse in speech and somtimes manhandle youngsters. They are also blamed for providing inefficient support to house holders and for answering 999 calls tardily. In their defence,much of the theft and vandalism in the area is committed by teenagers, often linked to drugs and glue-sniffing,although the latter is on the decrease. Open support for the police by providing evidence in court is rare sinse the public are afraid of recrimination from those accused.
